node.title: In Victory for Putin, Congress Drops Sanctions From Proposed Defense Bill
node.alt: An updated version of the proposed defense spending bill does not include sanctions for the Nord Stream 2. Above, Russian President Vladimir Putin addresses from the screen to the delegates during the Congress of The United Russia Party on December 4, 2021, in Moscow, Russia.
node.description: The updated version of the proposed spending bill came on the same day President Biden met virtually with Russia President Vladimir Putin.
node.content:
["An updated version of the proposed U.S. defense spending bill does not include a provision to bring sanctions over the Nord Stream 2 pipeline, in an apparent win for Russia President Vladimir Putin.", "The most recent version of the National Defense Spending Act for Fiscal Year 2022 was released Tuesday, the same day President Joe Biden had a video call with Putin.", "The House of Representatives' latest version of the spending bill, from mid-October, included a section on the \"imposition of sanctions with respect to Nord Stream 2.\"", "Those sanctions pertaining to Nord Stream 2 were not included in the updated version of the proposed bill, according to an explanatory statement from the House Committee on Rules.", "\"The House bill contained a provision (sec. 1325) that would direct the President to impose sanctions over Nord Stream 2,\" the statement said. \"The Senate amendment contained no similar provision. The agreement does not include this provision.\"", "", "
An updated version of the proposed defense spending bill does not include sanctions for the Nord Stream 2. Above, Russian President Vladimir Putin addresses from the screen to the delegates during the Congress of The United Russia Party on December 4, 2021, in Moscow, Russia.
", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
